Classic African American Songsters from Smithsonian Folkways ventures beyond the blues to show the true breadth of African American secular song. Drawing 21 classic tracks Ã¢â‚¬â€œ including five previously unreleased Ã¢â‚¬â€œ from the deep well of Smithsonian FolkwaysÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ archives, this connoisseur collection spotlights songs from ragtime, country, Tin Pan Alley, pre-blues songs, blues hybrids, and old-timey string band.
Unlike many of the historical collections on the market today, Classic African American Songsters doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t focus on a particular genre or artist, but instead delves in to the singers who were adapting traditional songs for the audiences of the day; songsters in the vernacular.
Marquee-name artists Big Bill Broonzy, Brownie McGhee, Lead Belly, Peg Leg Sam, Mississippi John Hurt, John Cephas, and more set the record straight that there has long been much more to the African American secular song tradition than just the blues.
